ai-pli-tv-kd13:1.1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

ai-pli-tv-kd13:1.1.7_0: “Well then, the Sangha should give the monk Udāyī the trial period of six days for one unconcealed offense of intentional emission of semen.
ai-pli-tv-kd13:1.2.1_0: And it should be given like this:
ai-pli-tv-kd13:1.2.2.1_0: The monk Udāyī should approach the Sangha, put his upper robe over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the senior monks, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:
ai-pli-tv-kd13:1.2.3_0: ‘Venerables, I have committed one unconcealed offense of intentional emission of semen.
ai-pli-tv-kd13:1.2.4_0: I ask the Sangha for the trial period of six days for that offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd13:1.2.5_0: I have committed one unconcealed offense of intentional emission of semen.
ai-pli-tv-kd13:1.2.6_0: For the second time I ask the Sangha for the trial period of six days for that offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd13:1.2.7_0: I have committed one unconcealed offense of intentional emission of semen.
ai-pli-tv-kd13:1.2.8_0: For the third time I ask the Sangha for the trial period of six days for that offense.’

ai-pli-tv-kd13:1.3.2_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

ai-pli-tv-kd13:1.3.4_0: He is asking the Sangha for the trial period of six days for that offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd13:1.3.5_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should give him the trial period of six days for that offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd13:1.3.7_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd13:1.3.8_0: The monk Udāyī has committed one unconcealed offense of intentional emission of semen.
